Posts.Content: Nov 13, 2011 05:11PM Blayze7 wrote: Hello all I had my first round og chem on Oct. 27th and was very scared. I did not know what to expect. My Oncologist stayed with me and put my mind at ease. I have been taking a walk everyday I find that the walks give me more energy. I do have to say that when you are tired just rest. My next chemo is Nov 17th that is a week from Thanksgiving but I feel so blessed that everyone around me is cooking something and bringing it to my house so that if I need to rest for awhile I can and dont have to worry about messing up anyones holiday. I feel so good about that.
Posts.Title: October 2011 Chemo group stjude10 cfdr

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2011 10:57PM Blayze7 wrote: Thanks ma111 my iron has been a little low for awhile now and I have bloodwork scheduled for Monday I rest when I need to but it seems like it is more often now. I read where a lot of the symptoms are cumulative as you go on. I am on adriamycin and cytoxan. I will make sure I talk to the dr about this also.
Posts.Title: Fatigue Blayze7 ma111

Posts.Content: Blayze7 wrote: I noticed that as I come upon my third treatment I am becoming more tired and achy. I want to know your experience as your chemo goes on. It is not so bad that I cannot function it just hits me in waves. I'm giving cancer the 1,2 punch!!!!!!! Dx 7/14/2011, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 0/10 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2011 11:13PM Blayze7 wrote: I understand what you guys are saying. When what is normal just go away you feel isolated. Everything and. Everyone is the same and they don't see that things have changed. I believe that all things will seem normal afterwhile. Thanks ladies...
Posts.Title: changes Blayze7 Blayze7

Posts.Content: Blayze7 wrote: I HAVE STARTED CHEMO WHICH WAS NOT AS BAD AS I THOUGHT IT WOULD BE. THE PROBLEM THAT I AM HAVING IS MISPLACED EMOTIONS...I HAVE NO PATIENCE WHEN DEALING WITH THE TEENAGE ATTITUDE. IS THAT NORMAL DURING CHEMO..THEY DONT WANT TO UNDERSTAND WHAT I AM GOING THROUGH AND IT IS MAKING ME MAD SAD UPSET ABD I HAVE NO IDEA WHAT TO DO. I'm giving cancer the 1,2 punch!!!!!!! Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2011 07:31PM Blayze7 wrote: Take it one day at a time. I am about to have my last ac and I always give myself anxiety nausea. It's hard but manageable. One day at a time because if you put so much emphasis you may make yourself sick from worrying so much. Whatever you do to relax do it more.
